Package gdi.game.dominion

Interface DominionInterface

public interface DominionInterface
A class that implements this interface can be passed to a BaseGame and is able to receive method calls at critical times during the life-cycle of the game.
Version:
2.0
Author:
Sven Huprich, Vanessa Klein

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    chooseTarget(Figure figure)
    Automatically called by BaseGame.
    Searches for the closest DominionTile (based on the given Figure's current location) that is not yet property of the Figure and sends it there using Figure.moveTo(DominionTile).

    The closest tile can be determined measuring the euclidean distance of tiles' map coordinates.
    void
    clickedTile(DominionTile tile)
    Automatically called by BaseGame when the player clicked on a DominionTile with the mouse.
    If the player figure is not walking currently, this method has the player walk to the passed DominionTile.
    DominionTileManagerInterface
    getDominionTileManager()
    Returns an instance of a DominionTileManagerInterface used for this game.
    Figure
    getNpc()
    Returns the Figure that is controlled by the computer and automatically walks to new target tiles.
    Figure
    getPlayer()
    Returns the Figure that is controlled by the human player.
    void
    reachedTarget(Figure figure, double time)
    Automatically called by BaseGame, when a Figure arrives at its target DominionTile.
    Declares the DominionTile property of the passed Figure.
    If the Figure is a non-playing character, it is given a new departure time that determines when the next DominionTile will be visited.
    void
    setupWorld(BaseGame game)
    Automatically called by BaseGame, before the game is started.
    void
    update(BaseGame game, double time)
    Periodically called by BaseGame in order to update the game.

  • Method Details

    • getDominionTileManager

      DominionTileManagerInterface getDominionTileManager()
      Returns an instance of a DominionTileManagerInterface used for this game.
      Returns:
      The instance of a class implementing the DominionTileManagerInterface.

    • getPlayer

      Figure getPlayer()
      Returns the Figure that is controlled by the human player.
      Returns:
      The instance of Figure that is moved by the human player.

    • getNpc

      Figure getNpc()
      Returns the Figure that is controlled by the computer and automatically walks to new target tiles.
      Returns:
      The instance of Figure that resembles the non-playing character.

    • setupWorld

      void setupWorld(BaseGame game)
      Automatically called by BaseGame, before the game is started. Here, preparations and initializations for the game are performed.

      Instantiates the Figures for the player and npc that are used in this BaseGame. Color suggestion: player=blue, npc=red.

      This method also randomly assigns each DominionTile of the map either to the player or npc (no tile must be unassigned!).
      Parameters:
      game - The instance of BaseGame that runs the game.

    • update

      void update(BaseGame game, double time)
      Periodically called by BaseGame in order to update the game. Here, the game's current state is updated.

      If the npc is not walking and has paused long enough, this method chooses a new target for the npc.
      Also, a check for the winner is performed. If a Figure has occupied all DominionTiles it is declared the winner of the game by calling BaseGame.setWinner(Figure).
      Parameters:
      game - The instance of BaseGame that runs the game.
      time - The current game time in seconds.

    • chooseTarget

      void chooseTarget(Figure figure)
      Automatically called by BaseGame.
      Searches for the closest DominionTile (based on the given Figure's current location) that is not yet property of the Figure and sends it there using Figure.moveTo(DominionTile).

      The closest tile can be determined measuring the euclidean distance of tiles' map coordinates.
      Parameters:
      figure - The figure to move to the next target.

    • clickedTile

      void clickedTile(DominionTile tile)
      Automatically called by BaseGame when the player clicked on a DominionTile with the mouse.
      If the player figure is not walking currently, this method has the player walk to the passed DominionTile.
      Parameters:
      tile - The DominionTile that was clicked by the player.

    • reachedTarget

      void reachedTarget(Figure figure, double time)
      Automatically called by BaseGame, when a Figure arrives at its target DominionTile.
      Declares the DominionTile property of the passed Figure.
      If the Figure is a non-playing character, it is given a new departure time that determines when the next DominionTile will be visited.
      Parameters:
      figure - The Figure that has just arrived at its destination.
      time - The game time in seconds when the figure arrived.
